semantics.accomplishment: Implemented type-safe multiply(a, b) function in TypeScript with comprehensive JSDoc documentation and proper directory structure setup
semantics.keyInsight: Function scaffolding with type safety and documentation reduces downstream debugging - zero ambiguity in parameter contracts

decisions.why: Prevents runtime type errors and enables IDE autocomplete for downstream usage
Isolates test code from main codebase and allows independent execution
Enables self-documenting code and provides inline help without external docs

challenges.what: Ensuring function signature clarity for numeric operations
challenges.resolution: Used TypeScript number type with clear JSDoc parameter documentation

risks.description: Function may not handle edge cases like Infinity or NaN inputs
risks.mitigation: Add test cases for edge cases in operation phase

risks.description: No error handling for non-numeric inputs in runtime
risks.mitigation: TypeScript compile-time safety sufficient for initial scope

approaches.rationale: Minimalist approach for demonstration - can be extended to module system later

approaches.what: Standalone TypeScript file without external dependencies
approaches.rationale: Reduces complexity and eliminates dependency management overhead

handoff.readyFor: Operation phase: Deploy multiply function, run comprehensive tests including edge cases (Infinity, NaN, negative numbers, decimals), and verify TypeScript compilation
handoff.context: multiply.ts file created in test_harmony3 directory with full type annotations and JSDoc. Function accepts two numbers and returns their product. Ready for testing and deployment verification.
